intro: Crotalaria ankaratrana, commonly known as the Madagascar crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a short stature, usually reaching heights of less than one meter. Crotalaria ankaratrana is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
